fields.description:
Resized images in Word docx that are displayed using Viewfile macro are in low quality and unreadable

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a new page
# Attach [^resized.docx]
# Insert a viewfile macro for Word and choose this attached file to be displayed
# Save the page

The image in [^resized.docx] is not in original size. It is resized in Word and hence, the image is shown blurred. Try to compare with [^original.docx] which contains unresized image and the result is expected (clear image).

The screenshot [^screenshot.png] shows the difference between original (top) and resized (bottom) output of view file macro.

*Workaround*
Either use an original/unresized image or convert the {{docx}} to {{doc}} file
fields.summary: Resized images in Word docx are displayed in low quality and unreadable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26536].
  {panel}

It can be very useful for both Confluence users and support engineers to have an entry by default in the logs everytime an user removes a space or a page.

This way it would be a lot easier to determine when a page/space is removed and who did the action.

I tried with different filters in web.xml but they don't display the page removed. You can deduct this by adding full access logs, but I find it excessive when you only want to get part of the information.

If this cannot be made by default, it could be useful to have a way to achieve in the UI or at least in Confluence documentation.
fields.summary: Log when a user deletes a page or a space by default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26535].
  {panel}

the recently updated (NOT dashboard) macro allows for filtering by "missing" labels.

Eg. If the filter '-hide' is specified, all pages with the label 'hide' are excluded from the result.

The recently updated dashboard macro does not support this kind of filter:
We get the following error:
These labels don't exist and were ignored:
   -hide

Our customer wants to use this feature to exclude certain 'rapidly changing' sites from the dashboard by tagging them with the keyword 'hide'.

This issue is certainly related to
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-20956
and
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-14327
(concerning the exclusion of users and spaces).
fields.summary: Recently Updated Dashboard Macro does not allow exclusion of labels

As you might see in the attached screenshots, it's not clear when looking at the history which task has been marked / unmarked!
The full task-List is beein highlighted as "changed format"

This isn't helpful!

If there are no other changes on the site, you might click the history navigation back and forth to see what's changed. If there are normal edits, its getting tricky and unusable!

fields.description:
We LOVE the table sort feature. However we thought it would handle dates more intuitively.

We have some date's in a table column (notice we use DD/MM/YYYY format) and when sorted in any way it fails to understand the dates. The current sorting looks at the top of the text and sorts by it.

We're doing a workaroud by adopting the date format YYYY-MM-DD to ensure it works but it breaks our standard date format
fields.summary: Table column Sorting doesnt detect date text

fields.description:
While a I am editing a page, when I try to include a new image, I can't upload a new file.

Edit->insert->image->attache files->Upload image

If the file is very small (few KB) no error message appears. Instead, when I try to upload large image files, I get the message "Could not upload the file to Confluence. The server may be unavailable."

Note that when I upload images using Tools->Attachments->Attach File, it works just fine for the same images.
fields.summary: can't upload file in Editing mode
Update Table plugin in Confluence OnDemand

fields.description:
The protocol on an external hyperlink changes from "http" to "https" when saving a page. I think this only happens if Confluence is being viewed over HTTPS. This breaks the link if the resource being linked to is not served on both HTTP and HTTPS.

For example, the link "[http://www.shrew.net/]" will be changed to "[https://www.shrew.net/]". In this case the latter URL is incorrect and results in a broken link.
fields.summary: Protocol of external link changes from "http" to "https" on save

com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ssl.LdapHostnameVerificationSSLSocketFactory.createSocket(LdapHostnameVerificationSSLSocketFactory.java:144) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:601) at com.sun.jndi.ldap.Connection.createSocket(Connection.java:305) at com.sun.jndi.ldap.Connection.(Connection.java:201) ... 41 more Caused by: java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.trySetHostnameVerification(java.lang.String) at java.lang.Class.getMethod(Class.java:1622) at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ssl.LdapHostnameVerificationSSLSocketFactory.makeUseLdapVerification(LdapHostnameVerificationSSLSocketFactory.java:80) ... 48 more{code} h3. Steps to Reproduce # Run Confluence using Java 7, not Java 6 - Java 7 is listed as a supported platform # Import SSL certificate of the LDAP server into Confluence's JVM keystore as per normal procedure # Add an LDAP directory, attempt to configure using SSL # Observe the error message and log entry described above h3. Workaround Use Java 6 h3. Cause I've pasted the original support case below, as it has a very detailed analysis of the cause: I am testing our upgrade to Confluence 4.x and I am finding that Confluence 4.x works fine with our configuration under Java 6, but fails under Java 7. If I shutdown, clear confluence-data/plugins-osgi-cache, switch to Java 6, and startup, it works. If I shutdown, clear confluence-data/plugins-osgi-cache, switch to Java 7, and startup it fails. In our environment, we use ldaps:// configuration to tie Confluence user management to our OpenLDAP servers. I don't want to provide our configuration here as it includes our internal hostname and authentication which should not need to be shared to reproduce or understand this issue. When running under Java 7, the error I get during startup (Embedded Crowd synchronization) and when I attempt to login (which fails) is: {noformat} Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to set hostname verification on SSLSocket at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ssl.LdapHostnameVerificationSSLSocketFactory.makeUseLdapVerification(LdapHostnameVerificationSSLSocketFactory.java:85) at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ssl.LdapHostnameVerificationSSLSocketFactory.createSocket(LdapHostnameVerificationSSLSocketFactory.java:144) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:601) at com.sun.jndi.ldap.Connection.createSocket(Connection.java:305) at com.sun.jndi.ldap.Connection.(Connection.java:201) ... 41 more Caused by: java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.trySetHostnameVerification(java.lang.String) at java.lang.Class.getMethod(Class.java:1622) at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ssl.LdapHostnameVerificationSSLSocketFactory.makeUseLdapVerification(LdapHostnameVerificationSSLSocketFactory.java:80) ... 48 more {noformat} As I expect reproduction of our issue may be difficult, I performed my own investigation and found the following... In this file: crowd-ldap/src/main/java/com/atlassian/crowd/directory/ssl/LdapHostnameVerificationSSLSocketFactory.java It has this method: {code} ... /** * Accept a sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl or a com.sun.net.ssl.internal.ssl.SSLSocketImpl * and invoke trySetHostnameVerification("ldap") through reflection. */ static void makeUseLdapVerification(Socket s) { ... try { Method m = c.getMethod("trySetHostnameVerification", METHOD_ARG_TYPES); m.invoke(s, "ldap"); } catch (NoSuchMethodException e) { throw new RuntimeException(UNABLE_TO_SET_MESSAGE, e); } ... } ... {code} Tracing the issue further by analyzing the Java source, I find that: - Java 6 provides a method sun.security.ssl.SSLEngineImpl.trySetHostnameVerification() which appears to be what Embedded Crowd is trying to find and use. - Java 7 does NOT provide this method. Therefore, the code works in Java 6, but fails in Java 7 with "throw new RuntimeException(UNABLE_TO_SET_MESSAGE, e);" which results in the stack trace we are receiving. My conclusion is that the combination of Confluence 4.x + Java 7 + secure LDAP is not currently working. However, Confluence 4.x + Java 6 + secure LDAP does work. The Embedded Crowd implementation needs to be modified to support Java 7 + secure LDAP and tested. Please analyze the above, confirm with the Embedded Crowd design team what the expectation is around why this method needs to be called and what it should do in Java 7, and document the problem on jira.atlassian.com using terminology which will be familiar to your team to expedite correction. For now, I plan on proceeding with Java 6 at this time, with a hope to change to Java 7 in the future when this issue is addressed. Thanks!
fields.summary: Can't connect to LDAP over SSL when using Java 7

fields.description:
When typing in the quick search field the results are populated in the order that they are returned from the server. If the server responds to results in a different order to which they are sent, that can result in incorrect results appearing in the quick navigation.

For example, if someone was searching for "atlassian confluence" and the client sent 2 requests to search for "atlassian" and then to search for "atlassian confluence". If the "atlassian" query returns after the "Atlassian Confluence" query, those results will be displayed, so while the user might expect that a page with the exact title "Atlassian Confluence" is displayed, if there are lots of other pages with "Atlassian" in the title, those pages will be shown instead.
fields.summary: Race condition in quick search leads to incorrect results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26492].
  {panel}

We currently use a cache to store the fact that we have already sent a like notification to a particular person because they follow people in Confluence. 

If another person in that person's network also likes the same page, this cache will prevent another email being sent. 

However, since this cache is local to each node on the cluster, it is not effective against likes on other nodes. 

To fix this, we should use a cluster rather than a node local cache.
fields.summary: Network like notifications are more likely to be sent multiple times on a cluster

fields.description:
When you exit an Inline Task list in Chrome, a <div/> is created instead of a <p/>.

Steps to reproduce:
# Type a paragraph
# Type [] then the title of an inline task
# Type Enter 
# Type Enter
# It looks like you're editing a paragraph, but it's actually a <div/>.
However, I've noticed it doesn't happen on this page: https://pug.jira.com/wiki/pages/editpage.action?pageId=114819082 , but it does if you erase its contents and type an Inline Task List from scratch.

Results:
* When you create a new Inline Task list again, it sticks to the last paragraph (no space before the line)
* If I fix numChildren == 0 ? true : numChildren == 1 && (li.firstChild.tagName == '' || li.firstChild.tagName == 'BR' || li.firstChild.nodeValue == "\uFEFF" || isEmptyIE9Li(li)) into li.textContent.trim().length == 0,
** Both would create the 2nd paragraph with a span & br inside. FF would put _moz_dirty="" in it.
** FF has a little problem with the 2nd list. It applies a zero height and makes it become a ghost element if you don't type immediately.
** Chrome, when adding the 2nd list, would remove it and come back to the previous paragraph.

Hydracode.
fields.summary: Chrome + Inline Tasks: Enter+Enter creates a <div/>

This annoys me to no end.  "Undo" should only ever undo the last action and not the last "few" actions.

Create a page in confluence.  Put some text on a line in say a bullet point.

Now press tab because that's what you're used to doing to get to the next field.  Notice how the bullet point indents.

Decide that's not what you want, so "undo" by pressing cmd-z.

Your sentence that you typed is now gone.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26472].
  {panel}

A Confluence instance that is not connected to the internet cannot check for plugin updates, or compatibility of plugins with newer versions of Confluence. 

It would be great to have a way for these instances to check for new plugin updates, and to check their plugin compatibility with new Confluence versions.

h4. Workaround
Create a test server with access to the internet, using the data from the live server:
# Set up a test instance with access to the internet, follow the instructions [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+Confluence+Between+Servers].
# Go to Confluence Admin > Plugins > Manage Existing, and see which plugins say that they require an update
# Update them in the test system, making a note of which version they have updated to
# Download the plugins manually from marketplace.atlassian.com
# Upload the plugins to the live system
fields.summary: Create a way for a non-internet connected (offline) Confluence instances to check for plugin updates

h3. Summary

When editing a table in a page, selecting all in a row and pressing {{Delete}} key, only IE browser behaves differently from the other browsers.

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Select all in the row

h3. Expected Results

All contents in the row should be removed as they were on Chrome and Firefox.
!after_delete_chrome.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Nothing is removed on IE.
 !after_delete_win.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Deleting an entire row from a table in Chrome, Firefox and IE gives different results.

fields.description:
*Problem Description*
If you use JIRA macro on Confluence 3.5.x, and use it like JIRA Issues macro. Upon the upgrade to 4.x the macro can't be edited, and _View in JIRA_ is clicked, the JQL would be produced wrongly.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Set up Confluence 3.5.x and say JIRA 4.4.x
# Create Application link between Confluence and JIRA
# Create a test project in JIRA and raise a bug
# Use JIRA Macro with syntax similar to the following
{noformat}
{jira:project = Test AND status = Open and issuetype = "Bug" ORDER BY priority DESC|server=JIRA}
{noformat}
# Upgrade Confluence to version 4.x
# Upon editing the macro couldn't be edited and when View in JIRA is clicked the JQL would be generated wrongly

*Workaround*
Create a correct JQL and use [JIRA Issues Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Issues+Macro] instead of JIRA Macro
fields.summary: Some JIRA macro could not be used after upgrade due to different usage in 3.5.x

He received a mail with this information : [confluence] Jira & Confluence Support > The RWEST Canonical Schemas > Trade Schema
The rwest canonical schemas is actually linked to another page and the actual mail should of been this [confluence] Jira & Confluence Support > Workflows > All workflows
fields.summary: E-mail notification update on page is getting mixed up?

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26464].
  {panel}

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Login to JIRA, then copy the Gadget URL for the Created vs Resolved Chart gadget.
# Login to Confluence, then navigate to {{Confluence Admin >> External Gadgets}}.
# Paste the gadget URL there. (Add a new external gadget)
# Create a page in Confluence, and insert the "Created vs Resolved Chart" macro into the page. 
# Make sure that the chart is displayed correctly after saving the page.
# Edit the page again, then edit the Created vs Resolved Chart macro that you inserted earlier.
# Click on the small gear button in the Preview screen, and click *Edit*

You will notice that the right scrollbar in the preview tab is not shown, hence, we are not able to scroll down to click *Save*:
!createdresolved.jpg!

h3.Workaround

The only workaround found at the moment would be to remove the macro and then, re-create it with the new data.
fields.summary: Unable to Edit Created vs Resolved JIRA Gadget
test

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26460].
  {panel}

To reproduce:
# create a table
# in one of the cells, add a few bullets.
# get your cursor at the end of the first bullet and keep hitting CMD+Backspace/Delete (or Shift + Home then Delete/Backspace on Windows)

+Expected result+: It will delete every word in the row and eventually delete the bullet and the entire row, moving the rows below it up one line
+Actual result+: It deletes the bullet but not the entire row.

The end result is that you can never delete that first row.

See the video here http://screencast.com/t/FqkvqLFQsnaZ

It seems to be caused by this moz-dirty element?
!https://img.skitch.com/20120807-ex7th6myyj5s8u5887545su4fq.png!
fields.summary: Cannot delete the first bullet in a table cell

fields.description:
When creating an Application Link from Confluence to JIRA, after entering the JIRA server address, some validation appears to occur but never returns. The 'Next' and 'Cancel' buttons are greyed out and cannot be clicked. No error message is displayed for a long time.

This does not appear to be related to proxies or network communication as it has been known to happen with a JIRA and Confluence instance on the same machine. Some versions of Confluence pre-4.2.10 are swallowing REST errors in the logs, so you will not see what is causing the problem in the logs.

In some cases, waiting up to 10 minutes returns a 'REST Request Failed: Bad Request' error.

h4. Workaround
Follow the steps in [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=181536632] to fix your Server ID in your database, then retry creating the application link.
 
If that is not successful, some customers have had success creating the link from inside JIRA instead.
fields.summary: Cannot create application link - Next and Cancel buttons are not available - greyed out. Cannot proceed.

fields.description:
These two examples have been tested in the search user/group dialog displayed in the page restrictions menu.

When you are looking for users, Confluence looks for the defined string within the name of the users. I.e.: if you search for "re" you will find an user called "fred".

If you do the same for an user, it works fine if you type the beginning of the group. I.e: If you search for "gro" you will find a group named "group". If you use any other part of the name it will not display the desired results. I.e.: searching for "oup" does not return the group "group".

Group search works as expected if you add a wilcard ('*') at the beginning of the string. I.e.: if you search for "*rou" you are able to find "group".

This is also a bit inconsistent with what the manual says (no wildcard needed).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Global Permissions and hit Edit
# Click the search icon to search for individual users
# Enter a partial of a username, eg 'dm' for 'admin'
#- Observe that the user is found
# Click the search icon to search for a group
# Enter a partial of a group name, eg 'eo' for 'people'
#- Observe that the group is not found
# I would expect this behaviour to be consistent across users and groups.
fields.summary: Wilcard needed in group search

fields.description:
Anchor macros can have the heading format, which will show up in the TOC macro (if it is the only object on the line, you get a blank line in your TOC list).  If you then attempt to link to that anchor from another page, the anchor link will take you to the anchor's location in the TOC list instead of the anchor's location on the page.

Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this bug:
# Create a page in any space 
# Put in several Headings from h1. to h6. 
# Put an Anchor macro somewhere on that same page and format it under any Headings from h1. to h6, or add the Anchor macro to one of the existing heading lines.
# Create a link pointing to that anchor
# Add the Table of Contents (TOC) macro on the top of the page
# Save the page
# The anchor link will appear as part of the TOC macro and break linking to the anchor later in the page.
fields.summary: Anchors can have Heading formats and are included in the TOC Macro

fields.description:
When using an international keyboard layout, e.g. Icelandic as me, the quick search shortcut doesn't work as expected in Confluence. 

The shortcut for accessing the quick search is /. This works as expected when I use a US keyboard but when I use Serbian or Icelandic for example this does not work unless I hit / on the numpad. If I hit Shift + 7 (this is / on an Icelandic layout) then the shortcut help is opened. Not what I expected.

Steps to reproduce:
# Open up Confluence
# Set your keyboard layout to Icelandic
# Hit Shift + 7 
# *** Shortcut help opened up. Expected focus to go to quick search ***

It should work the same, no matter what layout is configured. 

(The shortcut works in JIRA v4.3.2#616-r148546.)
fields.summary: Quick search shortcut key (forward slash) does not work as expected on international keyboards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26423].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
* Create new page
* Fill with enough content so the screen can scroll several times
* Scroll to the centre and click on a line somewhere in the middle (anywhere except the bottom of the screen will work)
* Start a bullet point by typing: {{* foo}}
* Observe the text box scrolls to make the current line the bottom

Expected behaviour:
No scrolling should occur. Clicking the bullet point button in the toolbar does not cause scrolling. The macro shortcut for starting a bullet point list should behave the same way.


This was tested on EAC and I was able to reproduce it every time.
fields.summary: Using bullet point macro on a large page causes the screen to scroll annoyingly
